> but what if the number of

any 
> methods becomes unmanageable. The situation gets ugly.

I think your=
 problem is more in the lines of: Having so many methods *in
the same class=
*, not necessarily the fact that you have many methods.

Therefore, the bes=
t option to you is to Refactor.  Try moving logically
related test methods =
to an appropriately named test class.  Following
your example earlier:

pub=
lic class TestCreateBatchLabelNoInnerClass extends TestCase {
   public voi=
d testNo1 {...} // Of course I would name the test
   public void testNo2 {=
...} // methods more appropriately
   ...

> This approach suffers from two=
 limitations. The first

e for every

With the approach detailed above, all you need i=
s a bit of cut and paste

fter the first failure-the remaining test cases won't be executed.
